intro: Luciliopsis benthamiana, commonly known as the Bentham's lily. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Alstromeriaceae, native to South Africa. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
